qas.question: For what practice did the first Protestants criticize the Roman Catholics?
In which century did the Council of Trent occur?
Which Protestant churches still honor Mary?
During which historical era did Protestant interest in Mary almost disappear?
Marian veneration became associated with which Christians after the Council of Trent?
In what century did Martin Luther honor Mary as the Mother of God?
In which century was the Council of Trent ended?
Which Protestant churches began honoring Mary before the 16th century?
During what Age did Calvin and Huldrych Zwingli form the Council of Trent?

context: Although Calvin and Huldrych Zwingli honored Mary as the Mother of God in <b5_0>the 16th century<b5_0/>, they did so less than Martin Luther. Thus the idea of respect and high honor for Mary was not rejected by the first Protestants; but, they came to criticize the Roman Catholics for <a0_0>venerating Mary<a0_0/>. Following the Council of Trent in <b6_0>the <a1_0>16th<a1_0/> century<b6_0/>, as Marian veneration became associated with <a4_0>Catholics<a4_0/>, Protestant interest in Mary decreased. During <b8_0>the <a3_0>Age of the Enlightenment<b8_0/><a3_0/> any residual interest in Mary within Protestant churches almost disappeared, although <a2_0><b7_0>Anglicans and Lutherans<b7_0/><a2_0/> continued to honor her.
